title: Introducing Yourself - Email Format
prompt: You recently started a new job at a Canadian company. Write an email to your team introducing yourself. Include your background, experience, and what you're excited about in your new role. Your email should be professional but friendly.
requiredElements: Goals or excitement about the role
modelAnswer:
Subject: Hello from your new team member!

Dear Team,

I hope this email finds you well. I'm excited to introduce myself as the newest member of our team. My name is [Name], and I started as [Position] this week.

I bring five years of experience in [field], having previously worked at [Company] where I developed skills in project management and client relations. I'm particularly passionate about innovative solutions and collaborative teamwork.

I'm thrilled to be joining such a dynamic team and look forward to contributing to our shared goals. Please feel free to reach out if you'd like to chat or if there's anything I can help with as I settle in.

Best regards,
[Your name]

title: Describing Your Hometown
prompt: A friend from another country is planning to visit your hometown in Canada. Write a letter describing your city or town. Include information about the climate, attractions, local culture, and what makes it special. Give advice about the best time to visit.
modelAnswer:
Dear [Friend's name],

I'm so excited that you're planning to visit my hometown! Let me tell you about [City name] - I know you'll love it here.

Our climate is quite typical of Canada, with four distinct seasons. Summer (June-August) is warm and perfect for outdoor activities, while winter brings snow and great skiing opportunities. I'd recommend visiting in late spring or early fall when the weather is mild and the scenery is beautiful.

There are many attractions you shouldn't miss. The [local landmark] offers stunning views of the city, and our downtown area has wonderful museums and galleries. If you enjoy nature, the [local park/trail] is perfect for hiking and photography.

What makes our city special is the friendly community and rich cultural diversity. You'll find excellent restaurants serving food from around the world, and there are always festivals celebrating different cultures throughout the year.

I can't wait to show you around personally! Let me know your travel dates so we can plan some fun activities together.

Warm regards,
[Your name]

title: Présentation personnelle - Format courriel
prompt: Vous venez de commencer un nouvel emploi dans une entreprise canadienne-française. Rédigez un courriel à votre équipe pour vous présenter. Incluez votre parcours, votre expérience et ce qui vous enthousiasme dans votre nouveau rôle. Votre courriel doit être professionnel mais amical.
requiredElements: Objectifs ou enthousiasme pour le poste
modelAnswer:
Objet : Bonjour de votre nouveau collègue !

Chère équipe,

J'espère que ce courriel vous trouve en bonne santé. Je suis ravi(e) de me présenter comme le nouveau membre de notre équipe. Je m'appelle [Nom] et j'ai commencé comme [Poste] cette semaine.

J'apporte cinq années d'expérience dans le domaine de [secteur], ayant précédemment travaillé chez [Entreprise] où j'ai développé des compétences en gestion de projet et relations clients. Je suis particulièrement passionné(e) par les solutions innovantes et le travail collaboratif.

Je suis enchanté(e) de rejoindre une équipe si dynamique et j'ai hâte de contribuer à nos objectifs communs. N'hésitez pas à me contacter si vous souhaitez discuter ou s'il y a quelque chose avec quoi je peux vous aider pendant que je m'installe.

Cordialement,
[Votre nom]
